Package com.mitsuki.jmatrix.core

Class DoubleArray2DChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mitsuki.jmatrix.core.DoubleArray2DChecker
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MatrixChecker
    public class DoubleArray2DChecker
extends Object
    Utility class for validating 2D array-related parameters.

    This class is a utility class that provides methods for validating and checking properties of 2D arrays. It is a static class, meaning it does not require an instance to be created to use its methods and provides static methods for checking matrix properties such as nullity, squareness, diagonalness, and identity.

    Since:
    1.5.0
    Version:
    1.0, 12 September 2024
    Author:
    Ryuu Mitsuki
    License:
    Apache License 2.0

    • Method Detail

      • requireNonNull

        public static void requireNonNull​(double[][] a)
        Validates that the given 2D array and its entries are not null.

        This method checks if the provided 2D array is null or if its entries are null. If either the matrix itself or its entries are found to be null, this method throws a NullMatrixException with a default message. This validation step is essential to ensure that matrix operations can be safely performed without encountering NullPointerExceptions.

        Usage of this method is crucial in scenarios where matrix integrity must be maintained, and the presence of null entries could lead to errors or undefined behavior in matrix computations.

        Since:
        1.5.0
        Parameters:
        a - The two-dimensional array to be checked for null references and entries.
        Throws:
        NullMatrixException - If the given matrix is null or its entries are null.
        See Also:
        requireNonNull(double[][], String), MatrixUtils.isNullEntries(Matrix)

      • requireNonNull

        public static void requireNonNull​(double[][] a,
                                  String s)
        Validates that the given 2D array and its entries are not null.

        This method checks if the provided 2D array is null or if its entries are null. If either the matrix itself or its entries are found to be null, this method throws a NullMatrixException with a default message. This validation step is essential to ensure that matrix operations can be safely performed without encountering NullPointerExceptions.

        Usage of this method is crucial in scenarios where matrix integrity must be maintained, and the presence of null entries could lead to errors or undefined behavior in matrix computations.

        Since:
        1.5.0
        Parameters:
        a - The two-dimensional array to be checked for null references and entries.
        s - The descriptive message to display as error
        Throws:
        NullMatrixException - If the given two-dimensional array is null or its entries are null.
        See Also:
        requireNonNull(double[][])

      • requireSquareMatrix

        public static void requireSquareMatrix​(double[][] a)
        Validates that the given 2D array is a square matrix.

        This method checks if the provided 2D array is a square matrix, in other words, a matrix that has the same number of rows and columns. If the matrix is not a square matrix, this method throws an IllegalMatrixSizeException with a default message.

        Usage of this method is crucial in scenarios where matrix operations can be safely performed only on square matrices.

        Since:
        1.5.0
        Parameters:
        a - The two-dimensional array to be checked for being a square matrix.
        Throws:
        IllegalMatrixSizeException - If the given two-dimensional array is not a square matrix.
        See Also:
        requireSquareMatrix(double[][], String)

      • requireSquareMatrix

        public static void requireSquareMatrix​(double[][] a,
                                       String s)
        Validates that the given 2D array is a square matrix.

        This method checks if the provided 2D array is a square matrix, in other words, a matrix that has the same number of rows and columns. If the matrix is not a square matrix, this method throws an IllegalMatrixSizeException with the specified message.

        Usage of this method is crucial in scenarios where matrix operations can be safely performed only on square matrices.

        Since:
        1.5.0
        Parameters:
        a - The two-dimensional array to be checked for being a square matrix.
        s - The descriptive message to display as error message. If null, the default message is used.
        Throws:
        IllegalMatrixSizeException - If the given two-dimensional array is not a square matrix.
        See Also:
        requireSquareMatrix(double[][])

      • requireSameDimensions

        public static void requireSameDimensions​(double[][] a,
                                         double[][] b)
        Validates that the given two 2D arrays have the same dimensions.

        This method checks if the two given 2D arrays have the same dimensions, in other words, if their row and column sizes are equal. If either the row or column sizes of the two arrays are not equal, this method throws an IllegalMatrixSizeException with the default message.

        Usage of this method is crucial in scenarios where matrix operations can be safely performed only on matrices with the same dimensions.

        Since:
        1.5.0
        Parameters:
        a - The first two-dimensional array to be checked for having the same dimensions as the second array.
        b - The second two-dimensional array to be checked for having the same dimensions as the first array.
        Throws:
        IllegalMatrixSizeException - If the given two-dimensional arrays do not have the same dimensions.
        See Also:
        requireSameDimensions(double[][], double[][], String)

      • requireSameDimensions

        public static void requireSameDimensions​(double[][] a,
                                         double[][] b,
                                         String s)
        Validates that the given two 2D arrays have the same dimensions.

        This method checks if the two given 2D arrays have the same dimensions, in other words, if their row and column sizes are equal. If either the row or column sizes of the two arrays are not equal, this method throws an IllegalMatrixSizeException with the specified message.

        Usage of this method is crucial in scenarios where matrix operations can be safely performed only on matrices with the same dimensions.

        Since:
        1.5.0
        Parameters:
        a - The first two-dimensional array to be checked for having the same dimensions as the second array.
        b - The second two-dimensional array to be checked for having the same dimensions as the first array.
        s - The descriptive message to display as error
        Throws:
        IllegalMatrixSizeException - If the given two-dimensional arrays do not have the same dimensions.
        See Also:
        requireSameDimensions(double[][], double[][])

      • requireDiagonalMatrix

        public static void requireDiagonalMatrix​(double[][] a)
        Validates that the given matrix is a diagonal matrix.

        This method checks if the matrix is a diagonal matrix, in other words, all non-zero entries are on the diagonal. If this condition is not met, the method throws a IllegalMatrixSizeException with a default message.

        This validation is essential for operations that require diagonal matrices, such as matrix exponentiation, matrix logarithm, and matrix trace.

        Since:
        1.5.0
        Parameters:
        a - The matrix to be validated.
        Throws:
        IllegalMatrixSizeException - If the given matrix is not a diagonal matrix.
        See Also:
        requireDiagonalMatrix(double[][], String), Matrix.isDiagonal(double[][])

      • requireDiagonalMatrix

        public static void requireDiagonalMatrix​(double[][] a,
                                         String s)
        Validates that the given matrix is a diagonal matrix.

        This method checks if the matrix is a diagonal matrix, in other words, all non-zero entries are on the diagonal. If this condition is not met, the method throws a IllegalMatrixSizeException with a default message.

        This validation is essential for operations that require diagonal matrices, such as matrix exponentiation, matrix logarithm, and matrix trace.

        Since:
        1.5.0
        Parameters:
        a - The matrix to be validated.
        s - The descriptive message to display as error
        Throws:
        IllegalMatrixSizeException - If the given matrix is not a diagonal matrix.
        See Also:
        requireDiagonalMatrix(double[][]), Matrix.isDiagonal(double[][])

      • requireIdentityMatrix

        public static void requireIdentityMatrix​(double[][] a)
        Validates that the given 2D array is an identity matrix.

        This method checks if the 2D array is an identity matrix, in other words, a square matrix with ones on the main diagonal and zeros elsewhere. If this condition is not met, the method throws a IllegalMatrixSizeException with a default message.

        This validation is essential for operations that require identity matrices.

        Since:
        1.5.0
        Parameters:
        a - The two-dimensional array to be validated.
        Throws:
        IllegalMatrixSizeException - If the given two-dimensional array is not an identity matrix.
        See Also:
        requireIdentityMatrix(double[][], String), Matrix.isIdentity(double[][])

      • requireIdentityMatrix

        public static void requireIdentityMatrix​(double[][] a,
                                         String s)
        Validates that the given 2D array is an identity matrix.

        This method checks if the 2D array is an identity matrix, in other words, a square matrix with ones on the main diagonal and zeros elsewhere. If this condition is not met, the method throws a IllegalMatrixSizeException with a specified message.

        This validation is essential for operations that require identity matrices.

        Since:
        1.5.0
        Parameters:
        a - The two-dimensional array to be validated.
        s - The descriptive message to display as error message. If null, the default error message is used.
        Throws:
        IllegalMatrixSizeException - If the given two-dimensional array is not an identity matrix.
        See Also:
        requireIdentityMatrix(double[][]), Matrix.isIdentity(double[][])
